body_html:
Not officially, but could copy FindMKL or something similar into tensorflow. Would be better organization but would need to check licensing. BTW, it is MKLROOT that intel sets (at least in my experiments). Seems like we should check for -fopenmp /Qopenmp and /openmp? I assume FindOpenMP hits those correctly.

For example, if you use Intel compiler on windows, you need use /Qopenmp to enable OpenMP; it is different from msvc or gnu-compliant compiler. I have successfully built tensorflow on windows using the intel compiler. body:
Not officially, but could copy FindMKL or something similar into
tensorflow. Would be better organization but would need to check licensing.
BTW, it is MKLROOT that intel sets (at least in my experiments).

Seems like we should check for -fopenmp /Qopenmp and /openmp? I assume
FindOpenMP hits those correctly.
